annotations.description: There was no time for the supporters to get bored during the game as it was full of action and thrilling moments. The away team was superior on the pitch today. The home players adopted a defensive style of play, while the away players tried to win the ball back as quickly as possible every time they lost possession.

Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) shows good awareness deep inside the box and jumps high to meet a perfect cross from the set piece. He steers a fine header goalwards, but finds the keeper prepared. Post! Theo Walcott (Arsenal) latches on to a sweet pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which only hits the right post. What an unlucky moment for him.
Nacho Monreal (Arsenal) delivers a lovely cross into the penalty area. Nevertheless, an opposition defender is alert and averts the danger with a brilliant clearance.

Tavares Fabinho (Monaco) didn't hesitate to knock his opponent down with a harsh sliding tackle. Svein Moen could probably show him a yellow, but he only goes with blowing the whistle for a foul. That's a free kick to Arsenal.
Yannick Carrasco (Monaco) fails to time his run beyond the last defender and the linesman makes a good call by signalling for offside after seeing the whole situation unfold.
The referee blows his whistle as Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) was too aggressive in his challenge.

annotations.label: whistle

Not the best game in the world so far but certainly not the worst either. Chances have been few. The visiting team dominated in most aspects of the game and the home side struggled to keep up. The home team's main priority is a flawless defence, with the away side gives them a tough time by closing them down quickly and aggressively.

Hello to all football fans, we are here to bring you a live commentary of the following match, describing all the most interesting and important moments. We'll make sure you won't miss a thing, so just sit back and have fun.

There was no time for the supporters to get bored during the game as it was full of action and thrilling moments. The away team was superior on the pitch today. The home players adopted a defensive style of play, while the away players tried to win the ball back as quickly as possible every time they lost possession.
